intro: Cakile lanceolata proles geniculata, commonly known as the geniculate sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with stems that curl and form a geniculate (kinked) structure at the base. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. This species is adapted to sandy and saline soils, showcasing a range of morphological features that aid in its survival in harsh environments.
